image.altText: A road sign that says Arlparra is 250 kilometres away from Alice Springs.

items.synopsis: Police say Major Crash detectives are investigating the circumstances around the crash, north-east of Alice Springs, and have notified the Northern Territory's workplace watchdog of the incident.

title.children: Driver killed, passenger injured in Central Australia single-vehicle rollover

image.altText: Aerial shot of giant floating gas plant

items.synopsis: Off Australia's north coast, two of the world's energy titans are entwined in a fierce duel. How it came to pass is as much a story about corporate egos as it is flawed strategies.

title.children: Billions on the line as ego trumps 'logic' in race for Australian energy prize

image.altText: An Indigenous woman cooks kangaroo tails on a campfire.

items.synopsis: In remote Australia, supply chains can stretch for thousands of kilometres, which means the cost of freighting fresh food is stretching budgets to breaking point.

title.children: Why a pumpkin costs $28, a 1.25L bottle of Coke is $7, and diesel is $3.37 a litre in this community

image.altText: A car on a race track with sparks flying underneath, with another vehicle behind with parachutes deployed

items.synopsis: Footage of the event shows the car hitting a barrier before continuing out of shot, narrowly missing a competitor's vehicle.

title.children: Driver in critical condition after car hits tyre barrier at Darwin drag race

image.altText: He stands in a dark blue shirt in front of a sign saying 'Cosmo' painted like the Aboriginal flag

items.synopsis: Sealing the 2,700-kilometre Outback Way could be good for remote artists. It could also bring more tourism, traffic, jobs and freight.

title.children: Sealing a road across inland Australia could forever change our most remote communities

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: Queensland Police officers stand near vehicles at crime scene

items.synopsis: One man is dead and another is in custody after an alleged early morning assault at Noosa Heads on Queensland's Sunshine Coast.

title.children: Man dies after alleged assault while 'out for his morning walk' at Noosa Heads

image.altText: Bridget McKenzie stands in a courtyard surrounded by journalists and microphones

items.synopsis: Coalition frontbencher Bridget McKenzie backs independent senator Lidia Thorpe's use of parliamentary privilege to detail allegations of sexual harassment at Parliament House.

title.children: Bridget McKenzie rebukes Barnaby Joyce, backs Lidia Thorpe for using Senate to raise allegations

image.altText: Usman Khawaja raises his hands and helmet in celebration of an Ashes century.

items.synopsis: Australia ends day two just 82 runs behind England's first innings score after Usman Khawaja scores his first Test century in England.

title.children: Usman Khawaja breaks English century drought, rescuing Australia in opening Ashes Test

image.altText: Colombian military pose with children for a group found in jungle, with the childrens' faces blurred

items.synopsis: A spiritual tea made from rainforest plants is being credited with playing an important role in the search for four children lost in the Colombian Amazon jungle.

title.children: How rescuers used a hallucinogenic cocktail during the search for children lost in the Amazon

image.altText: Kathryn Harby-Williams

items.synopsis: Claims emerge that Netball Australia warned players they would not send a team to the World Cup unless they signed a new collective player agreement.

title.children: 'We won't send a team to the World Cup': Stunning claims emerge in netball's contract fiasco

image.altText: Boxer Tim Tszyu smiles at the camera, with fists clenched and a world title belt slun over his shoulder.

items.synopsis: Australian boxer Tim Tszyu knocks out Mexican Carlos Ocampo in the most impressive win of his career to retain the WBO super-welterweight world title.

title.children: 77 seconds of mayhem — Tim Tszyu finishes world interim title bout in half a round

image.altText: Bouquets of flowers on the ground.

items.synopsis: Nine people remain in hospital one week after the shocking bus crash that killed 10 wedding guests, as the nation continues to come to terms with what happened.

title.children: Here's what we know so far, one week on from the deadly Hunter Valley bus crash

image.altText: A house sits in high flood waters.

items.synopsis: With demand for support exploding, the government has announced it will be expanding its multi-million-dollar scheme to help flood victims.

title.children: 'Protect home owners, taxpayers': Expansion of government scheme to offer additional support

image.altText: A group of men walk forward at a men's ceremony in Wadeye.

items.synopsis: Bruised and traumatised, resilient and proud — how the troubled outback community of Wadeye in the Northern Territory is trying to shed its violent past and move forward.

title.children: 'They all burned, all the houses': A bush town in anguish tries to heal from its violent past

image.altText: A young man in a black face mask walks while surrounded by Indonesian police

items.synopsis: A 57-second video of a shocking assault kicked off a chain of events that ended the career of an Indonesian tax official and saw his 20-year-old son accused of beating a boy at the behest of his young girlfriend.

title.children: When a street fight video went viral, it took TikTok sleuths no time at all to find the rich kids allegedly involved

image.altText: Narelda Jacobs, wearing a denim jacket, poses for a photo holding her palm to the trunk of a paperbark tree

items.synopsis: With Australia's Voice referendum looming, I went back through the archives to learn more about the work my father did to bring us to this moment. But he was also ultra-conservative, and I didn't have to dig far to uncover his homophobia, writes Narelda Jacobs.

title.children: My dad fought for rights of First Nations people. But while researching his legacy, I uncovered hate in his teachings

image.altText: Kylie Minogue sits on a red chair in a yard with dancers.

items.synopsis: Kylie Minogue's most dedicated fans have long been those in the queer community. Now, decades into her career, a new generation is discovering Australia's queen of pop on TikTok, and it couldn't have come at a better time.

title.children: Kylie Minogue has the song of the summer in America — and she threw out the old rulebook to get it there

image.altText: England bowler Stuart Broad shouts in joy as Australia batter David Warner throws his head back after getting out in the Ashes.

items.synopsis: Usman Khawaja scored his first century in England and Stuart Broad showed why he is one of the Ashes most deadly bowlers, despite a rare mistake. Here's five things you missed from overnight at Edgbaston.

title.children: Five highlights from the Ashes Test: Khawaja's latest milestone and a familiar tale for Warner

image.altText: A black sign on a fence with white text that reads "Now hiring: Sign writer/installer, CNC operator, fabricator".

items.synopsis: With increasing signs the economy is already slowing sharply, and many economists now saying a recession is more likely than not, why is jobs growth so strong and unemployment falling, asks Michael Janda.

title.children: The jobs market is strong for now, but unemployment will be the last indicator of recession

image.altText: Man in a blue suit with glasses reads speech

items.synopsis: Senator David Van has rejected the allegations, and in a letter to party officials accused the Liberals of disregarding due process.

title.children: David Van resigns from Liberal Party following allegations of inappropriate behaviour

image.altText: A man and woman stand with a cow.

items.synopsis: A retired Queensland cattleman and a media personality from Adelaide are working together to tackle rural poverty in Cambodia.

title.children: How an Australian charity is breaking the poverty cycle, one cow at a time in Cambodia

image.altText: A composite image of armed police and a man on a Melbourne tram

items.synopsis: Police allege the 57-year-old man had earlier stole items from a CBD business before attempting to flee on the tram.

title.children: Police storm Melbourne CBD tram after man holds passenger at knifepoint

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin meets African leaders.

items.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin interrupts opening remarks by African leaders seeking to mediate in the Ukraine conflict to deliver a list of reasons he believed many of their proposals were misguided.

title.children: Vladimir Putin interrupts African leaders pushing for peace plan in Ukraine

image.altText: a man hugs another man who is behind bras and is crying

items.synopsis: Nine men from Egypt, aged between 20 and 40 years old, were arrested, detained and charged on Friday, for people smuggling and participating in a criminal enterprise.

title.children: Death toll for Greek shipwreck rises to 500, as survivors reunite on mainland

image.altText: a helicopter flies above a village and giant rock face

items.synopsis: Relieved residents of a village in south-east Switzerland say a huge rock mass, which was feared would fall and destroy their homes, has come down but stopped just short of their settlement.

title.children: Rockfall narrowly misses Swiss village

items.synopsis: Police say rebels from the Allied Democratic Forces carried out the raid, burning down a dormitory and abducting an unknown number or people.

title.children: Militants attack school in Uganda, killing at least 41, including 38 students

image.altText: A man walks while smoke rises above buildings after aerial bombardment

items.synopsis: The attack is one of the deadliest of the clashes in urban areas of Khartoum and elsewhere in Sudan between the military and a powerful paramilitary group known as the Rapid Support Forces.

title.children: Air strike kills at least 17 in Sudan's capital, including five children

image.altText: a composite image of footy players, people on surf boards and emergency personnel at a sporting field

items.synopsis: Moments before kick-off, a clash between the Kurri Kurri and Central Newcastle rugby league sides has been awash with sadness — a feeling mirrored across Australia as  people have paid tribute to the Greta bus crash victims.

title.children: Black armbands, minute's silence and paddle out for victims of Hunter Valley bus crash

image.altText: A friendly-looking older man in a business shirt and tie sits at a table, looking to the right of the frame.

items.synopsis: A fiercely independent savant, Triplett was the subject of a book, a documentary and countless medical journal articles.

title.children: Donald Triplett, the first person to be diagnosed with autism, dies at 89

image.altText: a close up of king charles, wrinkled and red face with a receding grey hairline

items.synopsis: Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour, author Ian McEwan and immunologist and geneticist Sir John Bell are appointed Companions of Honour as part of King Charles's birthday honours list.

title.children: King Charles appoints Anna Wintour, Ian McEwan as Companions of Honour
